intro: Cordyline pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf cordyline, is a striking evergreen plant native to the Pacific Islands. It features tall, slender stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often a vibrant blue-green color. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters at the base of the leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sun exposure. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for landscaping and container gardening.
